705789f-a.text:
Myrtle Ave., north side, east from Flatbush Ave., Extension.
June 29, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
705789f-a.folder: Myrtle Avenue & Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

704338f-a.text:
Flatbush Ave. Extension, west side, between Myrtle Ave., (left), and Johnson Street (right). Also shown are Nos. 134-144 Duffield Street, west aide, between Myrtle Ave. (left) and Johnson Street (right).  No. 134 is as the right. The tall building at the right background, is the Wilcox Millinery Building.
December 15, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
704338f-a.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Myrtle Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

704339f-a.text:
Flatbush Avenue Extension, at Myrtle Avenue, showing the Subway
Theatre.
P. L. Sperr  August 22, 1941
704339f-a.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Myrtle Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

705788f-a.folder: Myrtle Avenue & Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

704340f-a.text:
Flatbush Avenue Extension, east side, north from Myrtle Avenue to Duffield Street. 1he buildings on the extreme right are on the east side of Cold Street. View 2 shows some slight changes that have taken place, especially the rebuilt gasoline station and the removal of the diner. Close observation will also show that occupancy of some of the buildings have changed. The low building directly across the roof of the diner in view 1 and behind the Sobol Bros. sign in view
2 is the Brooklyn Vocational School Annex.
P. L. Sperr  View 1: October 31, 1927
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 2: October 11, 1940
704340f-a.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Myrtle Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
